author: yperbasis
content: Is it correct that CLs don't need receipts/logs from EL anymore  after Pectra? cc <@954738828445372416> <@976542403269910539> <@687974325072035882>

author: somnergy
content: They don't for post Pectra blocks if they already have synced their view up to a Pectra block. AFAIK CLs used the `eth_getLogs` RPC to fetch desposit logs and process it. Post-pectra, deposit logs are included in requests sidecar which is obtained from the CL peers

author: tersec
content: This is sort of true but also they were only ever truly required (sort of) for proposing blocks. Once the chain has finalized, regardless of whether any individual CL client has, on not a post-Pectra, but once the condition in https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-6110#eth1data-poll-deprecation is met, then clients when syncing can assume that the deposits in each block were whatever they had to be, it's finalized anyway. And no new pre-eth1-poll-deprecation blocks will ever be proposed to any of the EF public testnets or mainnet

author: tersec
content: I don't see how CLs which only care about proposing on post-EIP6110 networks need to ever call `eth_getLogs` even once. Nimbus at least never does anymore

content: yeah +1 to what dustin said. we have removed all our code for requesting logs from the EL
